dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night is stillborn.

dialogues.text: Without sound or movement and nothing is in definition. A are degrees of blackness in this unlit world. The vague i of an African village in the void... a ragged line of tuk huts)... a bicycle propped against a mud wall... a soccer the dirt...

dialogues.text: Months later and the snow has thawed... it's summer... an Sam with other CONSTRUCTION WORKERS finishing their day, their tools, cleaning up. We notice that his gaunt cheeks filled out and he looks healthier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now a CONTRACTOR comes up to Sam, hands him a check.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help, Sam.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need me to stay on, I can.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're movin inside next week.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can drywall, tile, whatever you got. Know my way round some electrical too.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Sam, I gotta cut the crew. Just ain't enough work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam alone on these steps, lost in thought. Screen door op Lynn comes out, sits next to him.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She asleep?  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think so, in our bed... she's funny.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT.
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Job's done.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was goin through August?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shakes his head, and they're quiet... both of them si on these steps... the burden of this life catching up to this moment. 16

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN stares down at her desk with a frown, shaking her sitting in a small chair in front of her.  WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got somethin in Pitt, but you gotta have some college for that.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a hard worker and I learn real fast.  WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you got no education, Mr. Childers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam standing next to his Harley, talking to a  MECHANIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... don't deal bikes. Probably have a better shot if you take it over to Pitt. Or maybe down to Philly.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta sell it today.  MECHANIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give you four hundred for it.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's almost two grand on this bike. Them pipes right there is custom. You wont see pipes like that on anything round here.  MECHANIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, don't deal bikes. I'll give you four-twenty. Cash. Best I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam on the edge of Paige's bed reading her a CHILDREN'S B  SAM (READING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Into the street the Piper stept, smiling first a little smile, then three shrill notes the pipe uttered like a great and mighty army muttered..."  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's uttered?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like spoke up, made a sound. 17  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, keep goin.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns the page) And out of the houses the rats came tumblin, black rats, brown rats, brother rats, sister rats, and husband rats followed their little rat wives... Til they came to the ragin water where they drowned and lost their lives."  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got rid all them rats?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you sold yer Harley?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause it's what I had to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off her look...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna be ok, bug, don't you worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige curls into him closer, and we're watching him here. moment... holding his daughter... not so sure they're gon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Sam, behind the wheel of the car, parked, starin front windshield. REVERSE to see he's in the parking lot just watching the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty except for a handful of regulars. Sam coming throug taking in the place, the fucking grime and despair. Movin who is sitting in his same spot...  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well, well, wondered when I was gonna see you again, ole buddy. How you doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doin.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you was followin the Lord now. 18  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lil' bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie sizes him up, "how much is a little bit?", turns t BARTENDER...  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie, gimme a mash and bud... (TO SAM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want somethin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shakes his head.  DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that old Indian didn't die out there that night. Story in the Lehigh Valley News bout it. Somebody picked that poor bastard up after us, took him to the emergency room, you believe that shit?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God was lookin out for us both, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESS slides a shot and beer in front of Donnie...  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, here's to him. (DRINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't hear you pull up.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got Lynn's car.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She broke down on ya?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sold her.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh, shit, man. Shoulda come to yer ole buddy first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie smiling, inviting him back into this world. And we watching Sam, threshold moment here, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late and we see Lynn sitting at the kitchen table al has not come home and she is clearly worried. And then we pulling up outside, door opening and closing, and Sam com the trailer.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn staring at him, trying to read this man's face but h looking at her. Avoiding her gaze. Did he use? Is he high she sees a PINPRICK OF DRIED BLOOD on his shirtsleeve. He contorting almost imperceptibly. Her worst fear realized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she moves to him without saying a word... lifts up hi unbuttons the cuff of his shirt... slowly pushing up his to discover a NEEDLE PRICK in his arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then he pulls out a $20 bill and hands it to her.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gave blood over in Pitt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn searching his eyes and she knows he's telling the tr  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she pulls him close, hugging him tight, grateful.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin will come through. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we hold on Sam, his troubled eyes. Completely out of And we see that for this man the inability to provide for is crushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEAVY WINDS! -- FLASHES OF LIGHTENING! -- a storm startin the trailer park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn in front of the TV, scared, watching an EMERGENCY WE WARNING... winds buffeting the trailer... Sam coming into from the back...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two touched down near Harrisberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opening the door, coming down the steps, looking up t and it is fucking black, swirling, ominous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming back into the trailer fast --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn following him -- 20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- down the hallway -- WIND PICKING UP -- starting to roc trailer back and forth.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Paige, grab a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Lynn darting into a bedroom, scooping Paige out of her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming in, moving to a metal gun locker in the corner room, pulling out a SHOTGUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WIND -- SLAMMING the trailer now -- Lynn and Paige -- - watching as Sam moves to the center of the room, points of the shotgun toward the floor and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blows four gaping holes in the floorboards, then starts t through the wood with his boot --  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling, over the wind) What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks a hole in the planks, turns to Lynn and Paige --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige crawling through the opening... into a shallow tren underneath the trailer... Lynn squeezing in behind her... staying outside... no room for him... the trailer startin VIOLENTLY in the tempest... thin walls contorting around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and Paige starts to cry -- terrified -- Sam laying do floor next to the opening, close enough so she can hear h  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bug, you hear me?! -- Bug?!  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he starts to play a child's word association game wit something she knows... something they've played before...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinkin of a snail... you hear me, Bug?! Snail. 21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we hear her tiny little voice say...  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whale.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, Bug, good job! You said whale, I'm thinkin of a pail!  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said pail, I'm thinkin of a tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so this little game goes between father and daughter. listening to his voice... in the midst of this terrible s somehow becoming less terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brilliantly clear day and we see neighbors picking up a storm. Sam on a ladder leaning against the trailer, naili strip of bent aluminum as a pickup truck pulls up. Window and we see it's the CONTRACTOR from before.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tried to ring ya but your phones down.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam climbs down, moves to the truck, shakes his hand.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like ya made it through pretty good.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're alright.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn twister touched down eight places between here and Noblesville. Chewed up six hundred homes in Fulton County alone. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got all the work you can handle if you're interested.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm interested...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, seizing an opportunity here. 22  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm puttin my own crew together. We go 50/50 on the jobs. You cover any heavy machines I need.  CONTRACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60/40 til you pay me back on the tools. Then we'll go half.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a deal.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT of Lynn carefully applying a vinyl application on a new (but used) truck that reads, "Childers Construction  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.U. ON lynn's closed eyes -- smiling --  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin, Sam Childers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Months later and we're with Lynn and Paige, their eyes sh leads them both by the hand...  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna peek.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep em closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam finally stops them.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Open em up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do and both of their eyes go wide with surprise.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're home, little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE to see a modest two bedroom house at the end of t driveway. Their new home.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ours? 23  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure is. Go check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige sprints for the house as Lynn hugs Sam, softly star into his shoulder.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first night in their new home and we see a few unpack boxes here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige sound asleep on a small bed upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn in the kitchen organizing the cabinets. And Sam ente a box, sets it on the counter.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's everything.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get what's in the trunk?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn looking up, seeing how dirty Sam is from the move...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, you're filthy, Sam Childers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn tossing him a kitchen towel. Sam, smiling mischievou  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you callin filthy, woman?  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dirtier than I am.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I ain't.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are. I seen it. C'mon, girl, gimme a little shake... 24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam winking at her and playfully snapping a kitchen towel butt... Lynn giggling and scooting away...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't doin that no more.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just a little somethin for yer old man, c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he snaps her butt again but she grabs the towel and s back...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww!  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gimme a little shake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snaps him again and he feels the sting...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Lynn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snaps him again but he grabs her and they fall into e against the counter... laughing... and he kisses her... p first and then it becomes more passionate... and just as to lead somewhere we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years later and we're watching a congregation finish hymn. Sam, Lynn, Daisy, and Paige (10) in the crowd liste Pastor Krause.  PASTOR KRAUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today we are blessed with a special guest. It's my pleasure to welcome Pastor Relling from the Kilangire Christian Ministry in Uganda, Africa. Pastor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polite applause as a tall, white South African man named RELLING steps up to the pulpit, and in a deep Afrikaner a BEGINS --  RELLING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Pastor Krause, and thank you brothers and sisters for inviting me into this house of the Lord. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here today to talk to you about your Christian brothers and sisters, families just like yours, a half a world away that desperately need your help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam in this sea of faces, listening. 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parishioners slowly filing out of the church after servic Paige, and a few other women chatting by the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Lynn looks over her shoulder and sees Sam talking Relling off to the side, just the two of them in a corner discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first thing we notice is the relative "opulence" of t place... deep shag, new color TV, matching sectional sofa rural idea of making it. Sam, Lynn, Daisy and Paige at th table eating. Sam in his own world, oblivious to the MINO CONVERSATION until --  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige, go get some more beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige heads to the kitchen.  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking?    SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking about Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige comes back in carrying the beans.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have tigers over there?  SAM (JOKINGLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eat people!  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Africa?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just thinkin bout that fella today.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talked funny.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just from a different place than us, baby, that's all.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was thinkin maybe I'd go over there. Help em out fer a few weeks. 26  DAISY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Africa?  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see the tigers.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was talkin about puttin box beam roofs on school houses over there.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about finishing that job in Boswell?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll only be gone a few weeks. Be back before you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks later and we're in the rural countryside outsid Uganda. Sam on the roof of a bombed out school building w white VOLUNTEERS, working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks below to see a dozen black men dressed in the r fatigues of the Sudanese People's Liberation Army (SPLA). carrying an AK 47 and standing guard at various points ar compound. The lead soldier is a man named DENG. ANGLE thr we'll come to know as "NINETEEN", "MARCO" and "A.J."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's later and we see Deng sitting underneath an awning b working on his machine gun. Sam approaches...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Ugandan Army or what?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: SPLA.
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudanese People's Liberation Army. We are freedom fighters.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Sam Childers.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Deng.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a certain reserved nobility in this man, in the carries himself and speaks. An unwavering strength and se born from a lifetime of war and struggle. 27  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Deng's weapon) Givin ya problems?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. A bit.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double-feed?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme have a look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng hesitates, then hands his AK over to Sam who pops th and studies it...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer mag is tight. See here... (INDICATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The loads are feedin right to the barrel face. That's yer problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pulls out a knife and begins to work on the base plat mag as he explains...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you need this plate to ramp into the chamber... that way yer brass won't get stuck... (FINISHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... there ya go, should be better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam hands the weapon back.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you military?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not me. I ain't the military type. Ain't so good with bein told what to do.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you learn about weapons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam considers the question for a moment... then simply sa 28  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time ago. Different life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen or twenty volunteers lounging on cots in this dor cards, talking, smoking. And we find Sam off from the gro bunk, reading The Bible...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey Childers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns to find a British man in his late 20's named DA next to him, thick Cockney accent, smoking a cigarette.  DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of us are going into Kampala tomorrow night. Find ourselves a little fun this weekend. You in?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinkin bout goin up north.  DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy? There's a civil war going on up there.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's mid-day, blazing hot, and we see Sam approaching Den  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Deng, you wanna Coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam offers him a can and he takes it.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a question for ya.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna go into Sudan this weekend. Need someone to show me around. You interested?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others are going into Kampala. 29  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't my speed no more. I wanna see some country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng looks at him, surprised by the request...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dirt road cutting through grassy plain stretching in ev direction... and we see a BRIGHT YELLOW BUS speeding towa the distance, kicking a rooster tail of dust high into th and as it gets closer we see 15 or 20 men piled onto the hanging on for dear life as this bus bounces over the roa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sam and Deng crammed into this crowded bus...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They always drive this fast?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveling is the most dangerous time in Sudan. If the rebels find you on the open road it would be very bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence as Deng stares out the window. Sam wan connect here, but Deng is reticent.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got kids, Deng?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I have no children.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little village called Aweil. Many hours from here.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where your family is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Deng simply says...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family was killed by LRA. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unyama is about two hours from here. We will stop there for lunch. 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng turns and looks out the window again, silent, quietl the land blur past. And Sam says nothing more, intuitivel this man's need to be alone in the moment. A great, lost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dense sea of people. 20,000 displaced refugees living o each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is lived out in the open here... women bent over bri colored washtubs sloshing clothes in soapy water... smoke cooking pots drifting into the air... semi-clothed childr with even younger children on their hips, running everywh poverty and hopelessness is overwhelming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam and Deng walking through the camp...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Muslim North has tried to kill the Christian South for 30 years. Two million have lost their lives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng sweeping his hand, indicating the mass of refugees.  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... these people have been driven from their villages, however these camps are not much better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of wood sheds and worn nylon tents marks the hospit Each enclosure jammed with the desperately sick. Battle-w WORKERS move among them, doing what they can, caring for who are most desperately ill.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cholera and Malaria are everywhere, there is little food and not enough UN soldiers to protect everyone. Even here they worry the LRA will attack at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another SPLA soldier comes up to Deng --  SPLA SOLDIER 1 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you from Kitgum?  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  SPLA SOLDIER 1 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone wants to speak with you. 31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng turns to Sam...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Sam... I'll be five minutes.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course, do what you gotta do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng leaves and now Sam is completely alone, taking in th humanity all around him. And suddenly there's COMMOTION! workers coming into this tent carrying a WOMAN on a stret of the aid workers looking around -- a white woman -- mid her name is AGNETE CLOSSON, Regional Director of Doctors Borders. She sees Sam across the tent.  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. You. Can you help please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam moving to her --  AGNETE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to transfer her to the bed. Get her shoulders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam grabbing the woman underneath the shoulders as anothe worker gets her feet...  AGNETE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they swing the woman over to a cot... but as they do piece of blood-stained muslin that was covering her face away... and we see that she has been mutilated... her lip of her face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now a DOCTOR sweeps into the tent and begins to w Sam and Agnete pushed back, away from the action. Sam sti by what he's seen.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to her face?  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rebels cut off her lips because she argued. These are Kony's orders.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Kony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnete, suddenly suspicious, takes an appraising look of  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you with?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with Deng over there. 32  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What organization are you with?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working with a Christian group down South. Just up here takin a look around, seein a bit of the country.  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a tourist destination, this is a war zone. You stay in this area, you'll be killed. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing a bustling trading center on the border of U Sudan. Noisy and overpopulated, a maze of concrete and ti buildings, hundreds of people on the streets, riding bicy finishing their business before nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stale room with two cots, bare, institutional. Deng on his cot, pulling off his boots, taking off his jacket, ge comfortable. And we see Sam sitting on a small balcony ov the empty street below.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some say Joseph Kony is a wizard. A shapeshifter. He calls himself a Christian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a baggy of tobacco from his pocket and begins to cigarette...  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but I say he is Satan, who devours his own people.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kony is the leader of the LRA?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is the one we have been fighting for years. But there is very little we can do. Our weapons are old, and our boots are full of holes. We have been forgotten by the rest of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Deng turns to Sam... 33  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'cuse me?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for in this place?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't lookin for nuthin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng staring at him, skeptical...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you will get your picture and go back to your life and all this will just be a story you tell your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam has no response... and Deng lights his cigarette... a we hear voices... through the open window... children's v Sam peering into the darkness but seeing nothing... only streets... and then one-by-one... out of the darkness lik apparitions... we see children coming up the street carry bedrolls... some of them singing spiritual hymns as they laughing as children do... at first just a dozen or so... more... fifty... a hundred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng steps onto the balcony next to Sam.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are night commuters. They come from deep in the bush. Their parents send them out because it is safer to sleep here than in their own homes.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because death comes at night in the villages and refugee camps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we continue to watch this great migration of children streaming into this town... a few of them finding a dark below us... unrolling their reed mats... huddling up agai other for the long night...  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the lucky one so far. The ones the rebels have not found. The invisible children. 34

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam watching them for another beat then suddenly turning, back into the room...  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming down these steps. Deng following.  DENG (CALLING AFTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam exiting the hotel, moving to a group of 5 children hu the sidewalk...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up... let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children looking up, surprised to see a white man her  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children getting to their feet... and Sam moves to an cluster of children up the block as Deng catches up to hi  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ain't sleepin out here. Tell em they're comin inside. (to children on the ground) Ya'll get up... let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam starts to move up the block further, wanting to g more children, but Deng stops him...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, there are too many...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he looks up the street and we see more children here thought... hundreds of young kids huddled on the streets.  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you can't help them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam knows he's right. A moment here as he looks to the ch gathered, staring up at him...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can help these here. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and a DOZEN CHILDREN are ushered into this small room. pushing their cots against a wall so there's more space. speaking to the children --  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Settle down... it's alright... you can sleep here till morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and they begin to settle onto the floor... and now we particular BOY in this group... maybe 8 years old... wear GREEN SHORTS... and we watch as he and his SISTER move to of the room and unroll their mats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and eventually Sam turns off the lamp and we stay her dark... Sam on his cot, listening to these 12 little chil breathing... their shifting bodies on the floor trying to comfortable... and then...  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's closed eyes... sound asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just before dawn. Deng standing over him, shaking him awa  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LRA attacked a village last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looking up to him...  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you wanted to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sits up, looks around the hotel room and we see that empty... the children vanished... only a small, handmade ground which has been left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Deng, and a few other SPLA SOLDIERS jammed into the this truck, carrying heavy weapons, bouncing fast over th dirt road... featureless savanna FADING into sporadic mud the outskirts of a VILLAGE in the distance... and thin co black smoke twisting into the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and as the truck gets closer to the village we begin CHILDREN walking along the side of the road... night comm returning to their village... some of them huddled togeth weeping... 36

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and we notice -- Sam notices -- the little boy in the SHORTS, walking hand-in-hand with his sister, their faces masks of fear as they move closer to their home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup arrives and Sam, Deng, and the other soldiers and this is what they see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete devastation. 30 or 40 bodies mutilated and stack smoking tukuls. Some children already here, on their knee next to the corpses of their parents. If you could smell would smell of burnt flesh and death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam silent, aghast, just staring at the horror all around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now we see GREEN SHORTS and his sister arriving a village... moving to their family's tukul and discovering mother and father piled outside. Naked and burned alive. sister falls onto her mother's corpse and begins to wail SHORTS stands there -- frozen -- staring down at his dead and suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVEMENT! -- from inside the tukul... a small dog... a fa darting into the open... running across the dirt... GREEN going after it, yelling his name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam watching the boy chasing after his dog, rounding a co sight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just the boy's voice calling after his dog... and the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muffled burst -- in the distance -- Sam, Deng, and the soldiers running out of the village toward the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sam, Deng, and the others arriving at the source of t explosion. And we see GREEN SHORTS laying on the side of cut in half by a land mine... his dead eyes wide open wit surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and Sam drops to his knees... lifting what's left of into his arms and rocking him back and forth... and we wa terrible sadness overtakes him... something happening her fierce and overwhelming burden dropping into this man as this dead boy... in the dirt... in the middle of this sav world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and as Sam puts it, his "life changed forever" in thi and we see him looking up to the heavens... 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tears streaming down his face... saying something we can' it's a promise... to God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To save the children of Sudan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright, fluorescent corridor filled with garish adverti harried travelers rushing to make planes... and we find S down this concourse, carrying his duffle bag, his face expressionless. He reaches a revolving door but stops... pass through... sees Lynn, Paige, and his mother waiting the other side... their happy, expectant faces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they don't see him yet... and he just stays here... h watching them through the glass... and as Sam puts it, at moment he realized he would never look at his own family way again... in some way lost to them forever after what the side of road in Yei...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and finally he forces a smile, pushes through the rev and we watch, from this side of the glass, as Paige leaps arms... Lynn and Daisy moving to him too, embracing him, him home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige brushing her teeth at the sink. Sam watching her fr doorway...  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see any tigers over there?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, didn't see no tigers.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they do have them over in Africa.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I hear, but not where I was.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure am glad you're home.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, bug.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinkin of a plane...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late, you better get to bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he grabs her and carries her into the bedroom, plops the bed... 38  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, plane... I'm thinkin of a plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam giving in, playing their little game as she gets unde covers...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said plane, I'm thinkin of a train...  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said train, I'm thinkin of a brain.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said brain, I'm thinkin of a... (HESITATING)  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha!  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, you got me.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coulda said drain, or mane... like horse's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam bending over, kissing her forehead...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams, bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming out of Paige's bedroom, pulling the door close Lynn waiting for him.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You comin to bed?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a bit  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ok?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a long flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She senses more but knows this man well enough not to pus she simply turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. Just Sam on this porch all alone, been here for so eyes far off, images in his mind he can't seem to shake. 39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he steps into the yard... walking along the side of t just moving... trying to shed this feeling like snakeskin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and he comes to something on the ground which stops h his tracks... something we don't see yet... and slowly he down and picks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LITTLE DOLL. One of Paige's toys. Soiled and faded and dirt. And we watch him holding this forgotten doll... and see on his face ain't pretty... his world collapsing out him... trying to keep rein on his emotions... a battle he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn stirs awake, looks next to her and realizes Sam neve to bed the night before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn coming out the front door in her nightgown, sees a l a utility shed in the back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Lynn slowly pushing open the door to find Sam on the hunched over a pad of Paige's art paper... drawing... pap strewn all around him... been here all night...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, whatcha doin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makin plans.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been to bed yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gathers up a couple of the papers, moves to her.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a vision last night, Lynn. Crazy as it sounds, God spoke to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a sheet of paper -- CU to see it's a crude d building.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna build a church.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A church? 40  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right across the street. Not like Faith United or Calvary Fellowship. Place that ain't gonna turn you away if you a drug addict or a prostitute or whatever. Place for sinners, just like me, who wanna hear the word of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn studying him, trying to judge how serious he is here looking back at her, his eyes like we haven't seen them b Sparkling.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we gonna pay for a church, Sam?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got money in the bank. Business is good. Besides, I own a construction company... (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna give us one heck of a good deal on the build.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, shaking her head, catching his enthusiasm...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yer crazy.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Lil bit.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the other paper -- CU to see it's a another  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the orphanage I wanna build. In Sudan.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight months later and we're looking at a simple, cinder church which is under construction. A scattering of picku parked at the site and a flurry of activity. WORKMEN pour laying sheetrock, etc. And Sam in the middle of this crew the finishing touches on a timber frame which is about to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children at play, laughing, screaming, swinging on swing digging in a sand pit. And we see Sam off to the side, le against a (new) black Harley, watching Paige playing in t 41

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sam Childers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns to see a BIKER, late 40's, leather vest, standi 12 year old DAUGHTER.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Biker extends his hand, they shake.  BIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey bro, Ben Hobbes, knew each other long time ago.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Ben, how you doin?  DAUGHTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I'm gonna go.  BIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, sweetie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs off.  BIKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, they grow up quick, don't they?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure do.    BIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, nuthin fer nuthin, Sam, but rumor has it you was puttin up a chapel over there in Central City.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Gonna minister to anybody who's lookin for The Lord.  BIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good, man. Maybe you can do somethin bout your old friend, Donnie.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about em?  BIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't doin so good, bro. But hey, good seein ya' man. 42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A torn up house in a shitty part of town, windows spray p black. Sam pulls up to the curb on his Harley, gets off, of the bike's hard cases and pulls out the same SAWED OFF we've seen before... chambers a slug as he moves toward t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, junkie squalor. Two or three people slumped on a ra strung-out, watching a flickering TV -- and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming into the house -- sawed-off leveled -- junkies for cover -- YELLING! -- CHAOS! -- Sam moving into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam comes around the corner and finds himself face-to-fac CRACKHEAD pointing a .357 MAGNUM -- eyes amped up and wil shaking -- a stand-off -- and Sam sees a body on a bare m the b.g. -- bone thin and pale -- spent hypodermic hangin his arm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Donnie.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here for that boy right there. You gonna get in the way a that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TENSE BEAT -- not sure how this is gonna go -- and then CRACKHEAD shakes his head "no"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie in a bed, covers pulled up to his neck and he's sh retching in a bucket, deep in the throes of a detox. Sam here doing what they can, toweling off his forehead, tryi him warm, as Donnie pulls the sheets tighter, gritting hi shaking his head.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. God don't make trash, boy. Now he ain't givin up on you, so don't give up on him, you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And somehow Donnie finds strength in his words, and in Sa touching his head, and he nods. 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright Sunday morning and we're staring at the cinder b which is almost completely finished... the sound of a gar coming from inside, playing an unlikely rendition of a sp hymn... and a handful of people, dressed for service, mov cement stairs into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Donnie, dressed in his biker jacket and a butt shirt, sober for the moment, greeting people as they come the front door. Standing next to him is Daisy handing out  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Shekinah Fellowship Church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still under construction. Exposed beams and bare insulati walls. There's a small riser at the front of the hall wit organ, and the GARAGE BAND playing the rocked-out hymn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handful of people here sitting in pews. FARMERS in clea FACTORY WORKERS, BIKERS still dressed in their riding lea listening to the garage band and chatting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see Lynn and Paige (11) standing near the back nervous, checking her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam on his knees, sleeves rolled up to his elbows, wrench leaking pipe. Lynn and Daisy walk in...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's five-til and he still ain't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam hearing this, moving to his feet, toweling off his ha  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call him? (LYNN NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn exits and Daisy steps forward, shuts the door behind she and Sam here alone now.  DAISY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like this dress, Sam?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, mom? 44  DAISY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't never seen this one. I bought it a long time ago. Been keepin it for a special occasion.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice.  DAISY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never told you this but when I was pregnant with you, now this was way back, probably 1960, when yer daddy and I was still in Grand Rapids, a Pastor prophesied over me. Pulled me right up on stage and laid his hands on my belly and told me I was gonna have a Preacher for a son. (smiling at the thought) Yer daddy and I were so proud. I remember we went home and neither of us could sleep all night. Just laid there and talked bout you, bout what was comin.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just built a church. I ain't no preacher.  DAISY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are. You were born to it. Just took you a little ways to get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam entering at the back of the chapel, taking a moment t appreciate what he's looking at: 20 or 30 people here in that he built. A dream realized. And he walks down the ce shaking hands with a few people, climbing steps to the al switching on the microphone...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the band) Thank you, Tommy. You boys is soundin pretty good up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turning to the crowd, clearing his throat, clearly ne  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna thank ya'll for comin out for the first day of worship here at Shekinah Fellowship Church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some applause. Lynn and Paige sitting with Daisy who is b 45  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guest preacher we had booked today ain't shown up... so I thought I'd say a word or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotta yous been wonderin what made me wanna build this here church. Seein as I ain't the best seed in the bunch I can understand that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, considering what to say... and he begins...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buncha years ago I was runnin from some bad fellas in the woods over there by Cleary. Those old boys was comin after me hard and I reached in my bag lookin for my old shotgun but it was gone. My momma had took it out when I wasn't lookin and put this bible in there instead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam holding up a worn bible, and we start to notice somet here... a transformation happening in this man as he spea people. His nervousness falling away and a natural charis over...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I figured I was done for, so I sat down under an old tree with this useless book and I waited...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see the congregation hanging on his every word, id with this man standing before them. One of their own.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then the strangest thing happened. Them boys ran right on past me. Didn't even see me sittin there. Now the way I figure it, things would have turned out pretty different if I had pulled out that shotgun instead of this here Bible. And that's probably the first time I can remember God savin my butt. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God... and my momma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some laughter and applause...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure least I could do was build em both this church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the congregation responds with a Hallelujah! 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam holding Paige, her face buried in his shoulder, cryin  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be back soon as I can.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna miss my play.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have momma videotape it for me, k? Now I gotta git.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn pulling Paige off, kissing Sam on the lips.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call us when you can.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turning to Donnie, and we see he's back to the hulkin once was.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch out for em while I'm gone, ya hear?  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's done, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam winks, slaps Donnie on the shoulder, as we --  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see a line of SPLA soldiers (including NINETEEN, M A.J.) sitting in the dirt, pulling on NEW BOOTS, smiling, polishing them to a high shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Deng watching the soldiers.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came all this way to bring us new boots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng driving fast down this bumpy road. Sam in the passen Nineteen, Marco, and A.J. in the flatbed of this truck, e watchful. 47  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here, stop the truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam already out of the truck, moving into the bush. Deng following...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's not listening, moving through the scrub to a sma clearing... walking around...  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not safe here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam kneeling down, picking up a handful of red dirt, lett trickle through his fingers...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing a busy trading town on the border of Sudan a And we see a small crowd of villagers standing underneath watching a small color TV (the only TV for miles) -- on t we see a black man in a military uniform giving a fiery s this is JOHN GARANG -- one of the good guys -- the founde SPLA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tight, cramped office filled with villagers. Two or thr here at desks handling the administration of life in the renewing travel papers, registering newborn children, hea complaints from local farmers, etc. And we see Sam and De of these desks, a topographical map splayed out in front  ADMINISTRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a good idea.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a heckuva good idea.  ADMINISTRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be better further south. Closer to Kampala.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I wanted to be closer to Kampala, I'd be closer to Kampala. I wanna be right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pointing to the map. The Administrator turning to Den 48  ADMINISTRATOR (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should not be this far north.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you sayin?  ADMINISTRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The villages in this area are very remote, Mr. Childers. There is nothing there.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it seems to me them people need help the most.  ADMINISTRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Deng, Arabic) He will be killed.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Administrator turning to him, laying it out simply --  ADMINISTRATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is in the war zone, Mr. Childers. The LRA will kill you here.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you understand me, so lemme make it real clear to ya. I didn't pick this land -- God did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we're looking at is the modest beginning of The Ange Africa Children's Orphanage. A cluster of tukuls and 2 or rudimentary wood buildings built on the dirt Sam first le between his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see life already finding it's place within these b walls. Acholi WORKERS laying brick on what will eventuall schoolhouse and chapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we find Sam with two or three small CHILDREN who are no apparent reason. He's on his knees, trying his best to them but he is way out of his depth here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see Deng in the b.g. approaching with a powerf Ugandan woman in her late 40's.  DENG (INTRODUCING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam... this is Betty. She is from the village of Kotido. A few miles from here. 49  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to meet you Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty, no reaction. Just the incessant crying of the chil b.g.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is knowing that you need someone to run the orphanage.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm lookin for somebody who can keep the place in order. Make sure things is taken care of when I'm away.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can do this.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna have to take care of the children too, make sure they're fed, fix em when they're sick. Can she do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty hears this, turns to the crying children and softly  BETTY (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and instantly their crying stops.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her she's hired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Betty and another Camp Woman (ROSE) moving through carrying lanterns, helping the children get ready for sle  BETTY (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two share a blanket and tomorrow we will find another.  ROSE (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh, it's time to shut your eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam here too, doing what he can, tucking in a kids, starting to make a connection with these children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see a handful of SPLA soldiers stationed around th of the compound, standing guard. Sam and Deng sitting nex lantern by the front gate. 50  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what's funny? In English your name means "darn it."  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this `darn it?'  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng. It means `shucks.' You know, like you stub your toe and you go "ahhhhh, deng!" Get it?  DENG (DEAD SERIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not funny. In my language, in Arabic, names are very important. They tell you everything about a man. (BECOMING HEATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name proceeds you wherever you go. You are Sam. This is how you are known. In my language this means something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam feeling terrible, realizes he's offended him.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, buddy. It was just a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, awkward, just the two of them sitting here quietly beat. Finally...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does Sam mean in Arabic?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small penis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Deng smiles brightly. Sam realizing he's been played. starts to LAUGH. A deep, guttural, infectious laugh. Sam him, and we sense that at this moment these two have beco And gradually their laughter subsides, and it's quiet aga  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe in God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng considering this for a beat, and then...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was raised to believe there was a God in heaven. (MORE) 51 DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is impossible to live here, to see what I have seen, and not turn your back on him.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT.
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you'll invite him in again one day.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy stillness of an African summer night. Only the Kestrel hawks screeching far off in the distance, hunting and the drone of African Cicadas buzzing all around us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children sprawled on their mats sound asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng and a few other soldiers sleeping on bedrolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sitting on his cot. He rips open an airmail package a out a small VIDEOCASSETTE, slides it in a VIDEOCAMERA, hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SMALL VIDEO SCREEN we see Paige, dressed in a pilg costume, performing in a Thanksgiving Day play. Her voice through the tiny speakers as she recites her lines. Sam s what he's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of the SPLA soldiers sitting next to their weapons dark, smoking, tossing beads into a carved wooden trough, the ancient game of Mancala --  SOLDIER #2 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a mistake...  SOLDIER #3 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?  SOLDIER #2 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here... your third "house" is open... 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldier #3 reacting to his mistake as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPLA soldiers oblivious to the advance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam watching Paige's play -- when suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN EXPLOSION! -- machinegun fire popping o.s. -- Sam hitt ground, scrambling for cover --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam rushing out of his tukul -- sees the front gate OB from a grenade blast -- bamboo fence burning -- the death AK47's howling in the darkness --  NEW ANGLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam hustling across the compound -- joining Deng and a soldier behind a makeshift shed --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many are there?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two squads... (INDICATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There -- and there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam peering around the corner -- sees MUZZLE FLASHES in t blackness -- maybe 15 or 20 rebels moving through the bus specters -- flanking the compound --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are your men?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looking around, realizing the rest of the SPLA soldie scattered throughout the compound firing randomly into th  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna pick us off like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, split-second decision here -- and he starts to sprin the compound to -- 53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERRIFIED SCREAMING! -- the children cowering in the corn Betty and Rose here trying to calm them down --  BETTY (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay down! -- stay down! --  ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are protected! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam bursting through the door --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Betty! Get em to the church right now! (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly. (ENGLISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand?! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty nodding as Sam rushes out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam bombing into this shed -- quickly opening a metal pulling out an AK47 and mags of ammo --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam scrambling across the compound with the AK -- move Deng and pops a mag into the machinegun --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get yer men back to the church! That's our best shot! I'll cover you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam starts to open up the AK -- laying down a curtain suppression fire as Deng shouts to his men --  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the church! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and they start to fall back to the center of the orpha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and the other Camp woman herding the terrified chil this building -- the only brick structure on the compound then Deng, Marco, A.J. and the other SPLA soldiers coming moving to the window holes and returning fire -- 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sweeping the AK back and forth, trying to hold off th long as he can -- and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More of the fence eviscerated by a grenade blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam becoming overwhelmed in the fight -- firing as he ret into the compound --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam storming into the chapel -- turning to Betty --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning the children) Put em in the middle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and the other woman do exactly that -- they move th into a tight group in the center of the room.  BETTY (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down here! -- in the center! -- all of you! -- stay down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebels moving through the compound, firing into tukuls an everything on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Deng and the other soldiers returning fire --  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four on the right!  NINETEEN (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are too many!  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep firin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam starting to open up with his AK -- Krakakakakakak! -- shells showering down around the children huddled in the the room. 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebels swarming around the chapel, but reaching a point w can't advance any further --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and we see a rebel squat behind a shed and screw an RP launcher -- he pops up -- levels the launcher at the chap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krakakakakak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cut down before he's able to fire --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam sweeping his AK across the compound -- the other s burning through magazines and reloading -- rebels firing Betty and the children crowded on the floor in the middle STORM OF GUNFIRE -- and we stay in this little chapel -- this last stand -- until we --  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see the entire orphanage has been razed to the gro and a few of the children picking through the burned out and torched tukuls, looking for anything salvageable. Den Nineteen, and some of the SPLA soldiers loading the corps rebels into the back of the truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now we find Sam staring at the brick chapel in th the compound. The only structure that remains. Everything his entire dream -- in ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Lynn pushing a shopping cart down the aisle, p loaded with packaged produce. And we hear BUZZING. Lynn d cell phone out of her purse --  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we find Sam sitting at a table along this dusty, crow His duffelbag on the ground next to him.  SAM (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn immediately senses something wrong. 56  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see that he's not. This man is empty, alone, defea  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burned it to the ground. All of it. Ain't nuthin left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears the anguish in his voice.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nimule...

dialogues.speaker: SAM'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: ... I'm comin home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're watching her here, clocking the resignation in A moment of quiet for both of them. Lynn sensing the dime his heartache. All she wants to do is bring him home, hol close, ease his pain... but she knows that's not what he not this man...

dialogues.speaker: LYNN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sam?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Can you hear me?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see her move around a corner into an empty aisle, the other shoppers. And she says... 57  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then quit feelin sorry for yerself. Them children have had their whole lives burned to the ground and worse. How many of them you see givin up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we watch Sam listening, finding strength in what this next...

dialogues.speaker: LYNN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: God gave you purpose, Sam Childers. Now stop yer cryin, get off yer butt and build it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEGIN SEQUENCE. Giving us a sense that many months are pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam and a crew of VILLAGE MEN hauling the charred remn tukuls and burned building out of the compound on their b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The remainder of the bamboo fence that once surrounded orphanage being torn down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Nineteen, Marco, A.J. and a few other SPLA soldiers cu bush away from the edge of the compound with machetes.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it all down... so they got nowhere to hide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam, Deng and the crew of village men digging post hol the perimeter of the orphanage...  VILLAGE MAN 1 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far?  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the way around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The men sinking metal beams into the holes with cement surrounding the compound with heavy gage CHAINLINK FENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- New DORMS being built from brick. An INFIRMARY. A MESS SOLDIER'S BARRACKS. And finally, Sam laying the last bric chapel in the center of the compound. Completing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple administrative office with a short-wave radio an phone. Sam here, sitting at a desk when we hear a knock a 58  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and we see Deng.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preacher, you need to come see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam following Deng to the center of the compound where we camp women (including Betty and Rose) dressed in colorful headdresses. Maybe 80 children here, quietly sitting in t watching the women. Nineteen, Marco, A.J. and the rest of soldiers here too, watching from the side.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin on?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acholi people were farmers before they were driven from their ancestral homeland. Each year they blessed the soil before a planting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now the women begin to move in unison... singing an a Acholi song as one of the older orphan boys beats a small accompaniment...  DENG (CONT'D) (TRANSLATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are saying that fire brings strength and ashes abundance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women continuing their dance... moving in a tight cir stomping their feet as they sing...  DENG (CONT'D) (TRANSLATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... when the land burns, the next year the soil produces more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Betty peels away from the group and approaches Sa to him directly in Arabic...  BETTY (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children are your fields...  DENG (TRANSLATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... she says you are a farmer and these children are your crops... 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looking to the 80 little orphans watching this from t and now Betty bends down and scoops up a bit of ashen ear her finger across his forehead, blessing him...  BETTY (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and this ground will grow them tall.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and this ground is richer now and they will grow stronger because of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF SAM standing here with his ashen face, staring at the in front of him -- his African family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Days later and we see Sam here with Nineteen and a few ot soldiers, eating lunch, trying to learn their language. A humorous to these guys as Sam tries to pronounce some wor Arabic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly we hear YELLING coming from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming out fast, sees soldiers pulling open the front THREE pickup trucks speed into the compound -- SPLA milit - skidding to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushing over as soldiers help two YOUNG BOYS out of o trucks. Both are around 5 years old, injured and crying. third child is lifted out in a makeshift stretcher -- thi - 10 years old -- her broken body limp and bleeding profu mumbling something to herself in Arabic over-and-over aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- DOORS BANGING OPEN! -- CONTROLLED CHAOS as the childre hauled into this clinic -- Betty taking care of Alice -- off -- hooking her up to an IV as Sam moves to her bedsid little girl still mumbling quietly --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is she saying?  BETTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is asking what she did wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam taking Alice's hand in his... very slowly her beautif open and she sees him... and says something in Arabic...  BETTY (CONT'D) (TRANSLATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is asking if you are `The Preacher.' 60  SAM (NODDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her she's gonna be ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty translates and Alice smiles faintly... and now one other camp women comes over and Sam steps back so they ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming out of the infirmary and finding Deng here wit the SPLA soldiers who brought the children.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
