dialogues.text: Where did they find em?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their village was hit out Adjumani.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Sam, hearing this, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam and Deng sitting outside the infirmary, ex been here all night waiting. And now the door opens and B out. She looks down at them and simply shakes her head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we know Alice is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it looks like a grenade has gone off inside Sam. And grabs an AK and gets up, seething, walks off...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sam walking fast through the compound... Deng followi  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adjumani.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, please wait...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't waitin. You wanna see what waitin gets ya? Take a look in that buildin over there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam reaching the SUV and starting to gear up... 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP the plaintive wail of an Acholi WAR SONG... haunt ethereal... and then a chorus of voices rising up... taki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bombing down this rutted, red dirt road. The engine at fu Sam, Deng, Nineteen, Marco, and A.J. jammed into this tru in dead silence... AK47's bouncing between their knees... sound of the WAR SONG playing as we watch these men... a stillness on their faces... thinking of what men do just their own death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see two LRA VEHICLES approaching in the distance... a and a PICKUP TRUCK behind it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four CHILD SOLDIERS squatting in the flatbed of this truc AK47's. We recognize one of the boys as the younger broth opening scene -- WILLIAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With two ADULT REBELS in this Jeep as they drive down thi bombed-out vehicles... and in the distance we see the smo wreckage of a transport truck on the side of the road... smoke hanging over the road like a black curtain... block vision of the road ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and the Jeep punches into the black smoke followed by truck... and we're lost in the swirling haze for a moment coming out the other side... and this is what we see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM -- standing in the middle of the road ahead of us sho RPG -- the ADULT REBELS see him just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOOOSH! -- an RPG streaks right at us and DETONATES -- and the Jeep flips onto it's side --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PICKUP GRINDS TO A STOP! -- the driver slamming it in - accelerating back into the curtain of smoke -- trying t fuck out of there when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BBrrraaaappp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .30 CALIBER MACHINEGUN STRAFE across the front hood --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and we see A.J. behind the .30 cal -- opening it up -- BBRAAAAAAPPP! -- BBRAAAAAPPP! -- blasting the engine comp the truck, trying to disable it -- 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the pickup truck reversing out of the black smoke -- O CONTROL -- going off the road into a ditch -- WILLIAM and boys bailing out of the flatbed -- TWO ADULT REBELS pilin the cab -- scrambling for cover behind the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Deng, A.J. and the others hustling through the smoke finding cover. From Sam's vantage point he sees rebels hi behind the disabled truck for cover -- shooting back -- a firefight -- the big .30 cal ROARING offscreen but the tr protecting the rebels -- no clear shot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William and the other child soldiers here with two ADULT crouched behind the truck for cover -- the ADULT REBELS r fire, but the children aren't moving, scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William peers around the truck and sees Sam fifty yards a to the boys next to him...  WILLIAM (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the white preacher!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other boys reacting, this means something to them. An of the ADULT REBEL turns to the children...  ADULT REBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he pops up and returns fire, but the boys don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCO running through the smoke toward Sam. He hits the g starts to screw an RPG into his launcher... he wants to h transport truck, but Sam shakes his head, waves him off..  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shot! There are children behind the truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco hears this, ditches the RPG and picks up his AK.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco laying down suppression fire as Sam sprints across advancing on the transport truck -- firing his AK from th bullets zinging past him -- he dives behind a berm and fi next to Deng. Neither man says a word as they jam fresh m their AK's, gunfire erupting all around them. 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The adult rebels continue fighting -- alternately popping behind the truck and returning fire. The ADULT REBEL real William and the other boys still aren't fighting --  ADULT REBEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight you cowards!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But William and the other boys don't move, and the Adult shooting until his mag clicks empty. He looks around and LAUNCHER on the ground, picks it up, arms it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Deng behind the berm. Sam peers over just as GUNF him by inches. He drops back.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just go home?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not your war.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leavin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng shakes his head --  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, I ain't leavin neither...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam chambers a round, pivots around the berm as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the Adult Rebel stands up with the RPG -- fires! -- at instant William shoots him in the head -- he jerks -- WOO the missile launching at a bad angle as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RPG streaking directly at him -- hitting the ground short

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a long beat... only silence... and then slowly the wh to fade... and we see Sam flat on his back... eyes blinki shell-shocked... staring up at blue sky... and then a sha over him... someone stepping into his POV... 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it's William, hands held open in surrender, staring curio this strange white man laying in the dirt... and now Deng appear next to Sam and help him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see the battle is over. The remaining child soldie emerging from behind the LRA truck... laying down their w walking toward Sam... joining William... staring at this in front of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... William reaches into his pocket and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Deng and Marco REACT -- lifting their AK's -- "Don't move!" -- but the boy only pulls out a FADED PHOTOGRAPH.. he grabbed just before his capture... a picture of him an brother... standing next to each other smiling.  WILLIAM (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 children laying on the floor on reed mats, getting rea sleep. And we find William in mid-conversation with a you named Anthony.  WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Where are you from?  ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jabal.  WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you with the rebels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony nods. William pulls out his photograph.  WILLIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know my brother? He was called Christopher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony studying the photograph...  WILLIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a funny left eye. It looks the other way sometimes. Do you remember him?  ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William folding up the photograph, getting up, moving to little boy a few feet away... kneeling next to him... and continues...  WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am William. Were you with the rebels? 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soldier cuts off the generator and the compound goes bl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam on his cot when the light goes out. He lea torches a small Kerosene lamp next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children on their mats in the dark now... quiet... a younger ones whimpering, starting to cry... the darkness too much... reminding them of past horrors... and then we FAINT VOICE in this dark room... singing quietly... an an African lullaby... and then other little voices joining i singing this song they all know... a song their mother's to them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sam hearing the soft chorus drift across the compound finding comfort in it too... blowing out the lamp and lay the dark... listening to the children sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SLOW DISSOLVE... life springing up in the camp... dayli breaking... a routine seen here... Betty, Rose and the ot women arriving at the orphanage... cooking fires being li soldiers drinking cups of strong coffee, warming themselv long night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and Sam coming out of his tukul carrying his duffle b discovering William curled up next to his door, sleeping the dirt... been there all night. William stirring awake, above him and scrambling to his feet.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mornin, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William, no response. Just staring up at him.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't you gonna say nuthin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William, nothing.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam walks across the compound followed by William a f behind... and he reaches Deng, Betty, Nineteen, and a few other volunteers waiting by the truck... 66  DENG (MEANING WILLIAM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you've got yourself a bodyguard.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tosses his bag into the back, says goodbye to everyon  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of things while I'm gone, ok?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, Preacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands and Sam gets into the truck... and we se already here, sitting in the backseat.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't come with me, buddy.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to William, Arabic) Get out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But William isn't moving...  DENG (CONT'D) (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! -- out! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and finally Deng reaches in and grabs him... tries to out but he fights back... yelling as Deng drags him out o truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turning around in his seat as we pull away from the c and he sees William still struggling in Deng's arms... an he breaks free and SPRINTS for the truck as it drives off he can... chasing Sam until he no longer can.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see two teens moving toward the sound of a crowd c inside the church, responsive, "Hallelujah!"... and then over it all...

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: In your actions you give service to the Lord... 67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam at the pulpit in mid-sermon. There is an air of Fire Brimstone to what we're watching here... electric... the congregation listening in rapt attention...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he's not interested in your good thoughts... your good intentions... he wants your hands... your backs... your sweat... your blood to pour into the foundation that will build up his kingdom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ad-libbed SHOUTS and PRAISE... and now we see Lynn, Daisy and Paige in the congregation listening... as we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn and Sam walking through the facility, and we see thi alive with activity. More than just a church, this is a c center. Lynn opening a door and we see a Volunteer here w little children running around this playroom...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We started daycare last month. Monday thru Friday from 8 to 2... Sundays after first worship for a few hours if anybody needs it. How you doin, Sue?  VOLUNTEER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Hey Pastor.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn pulling the door closed and they continue... moving of stairs to the basement where we see children and paren of them playing ping-pong and air hockey... others in a c rehearsing for a Christmas play...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been thinkin we need to put up a playground. Swings. Some things the kids can climb on.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't build anymore. Not for awhile.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said Sundays has been full.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn outs been good, but that don't mean people is givin money. (MORE) 68 LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Economy is in trouble, construction business is slow. Times is tight.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be good for them kids, Lynn.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got the playground over in Cairnbrook. And they can play at the school on weekends if they want

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turning to her --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not talking bout here. Talkin about the orphange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn catching up to him now, realizing his head is still Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam working on his Harley. Donnie entering in the b.g.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'cha workin on, buddy?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble with the push rods I think. She's runnin kinda rough.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda kept that mild in there `stead a buildin up a hot rod. Let's see whatcha got here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie moving next to him, working on the bike...  DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... never had these problems when we was runnin solid lifters, huh?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to fix them old shovelheads on the side of the road with a buckknife and a wire hanger.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that year we went to the Freakers Ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam smiling...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that old `78 broke down five times on that trip. 69  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds about right. Shoot, we had more fun tryin to get there than when we finally did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Donnie share a laugh.  DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you about somethin?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad I'm walkin with the Lord and all, but sometimes I ain't sure I'm gonna be able to do what he wants me to do.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lord don't ask for nuthin you can't deliver, buddy. And yer one tough ole boy.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I ain't so sure how tough I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see in Donnie's eyes just how troubled he is.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we pray together then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they both take a knee, bowing their heads as Sam cont  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our gracious Heavenly Father, bless us with the strength to carry on in your name. And grant us, in our darkest hours, the understandin that you are always by our side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we leave these two men, their heads bowed in quiet su next to this Harley, praying for strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four or five gleaming sedans on this showroom floor. And sitting across from BILL WALLACE, late 40's, gold Rolex.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... from what I heard, you built yourself one helluva church over there in Central City. 70  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still got a ways to go, but we're gettin there. You should come on by one of these Sundays, bring the family.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice of you, but we're at Calvary now. Bit more our speed over there I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, getting down to business...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverand Carlton gives a mean sermon, puts me to shame. Anyway Bill, I'm here cause I wanna talk to you about what we're doin over there in Africa.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course I know about what you're doin. Helluva thing helpin out those kids, Sam.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, but I'm gonna be straight with ya. We're hurtin for money... If we had a little bit more support from people like yourself sure would help things run a lot smoother over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill feeling the rub, shaking his head...  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, look, everybody is feelin the pinch around here.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear that, but you gotta understand that them kids over there got nuthin. I mean nuthin, Bill, and I'm not asking for much.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you lookin for?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand dollars.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Sam! Five thousand dollars?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That keeps them doors open for another six months. 71  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are losin their jobs left and right round here. Tough to be askin for five thousand dollars for a buncha African children half-way around the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shifting, not giving up, coming at him another way...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. We got problems right here. But with that kinda money we could feed them kids, house them kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill staring at him, saying nothing, on the spot. Sam hop somehow he's reached this man. And finally Bill stands up  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, tell you what, lemme see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam feeling this victory, flashing a smile, shaking Bill'  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you and the family come over to the house next Sunday. We're havin a little barbeque, ok?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upscale French provincial in suburban Johnstown. A "barbe underway. 15 couples here with their kids and a handful o in white-tie offering champagne and hors d'oeuvres to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOOR BELL RINGING -- and we see a perky woman in her late coming through the crowd, blonde hair from a bottle, acce the hilt, holding a glass of white wine. SHANNON WALLACE. the door to find Sam, Lynn, and Paige standing in the doo  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they enter... Lynn smiling awkwardly, dressed in the dress we saw her in previously... her only dress... and S around this enormous room...  SHANNON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll must be the Childers. Welcome. I'm Shannon, Bill's ball-n-chain. 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling, a joke she loves...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lynn, this here is Sam, our daughter Paige.  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: There he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody turning to see the car dealer coming through th smiling, a little drunk. AD-LIBBED introductions and then  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad ya'll could make it. Get on in here and meet some people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill ushering them deeper into the house... quick intros guests as they pass... Sam, Lynn, and Paige taking it all starting to sense the dimensions of this massive house... waiters in their pressed jackets offering them food... th extravagance... like nothing they've ever seen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Bill pulling Sam off from the crowd so it's just the them... taking an envelope from his jacket and handing it  BILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a little somethin for the kids, ok? What we were talking about.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Bill.  BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Now c'mon, can I get ya a mojito or somethin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming into this bathroom and locking the door... tak envelope out of his pocket and tearing it open... pulling personal check -- CLOSE UP to see it's in the amount of $

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD ON Sam face, and it's disgust we see in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front door opening fast and Lynn and Paige coming out, fo Sam, pushing them along...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam... 73  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why we leavin so soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon appearing in the doorway in the b.g., calling aft  SHANNON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything alright?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn turning to respond, but Sam keeps her moving forward driveway, past the line of parked BMW's and Mercedes to t at the curb...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they load into the truck...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonuvabitch is cryin pour-mouth to me and he's livin in the damn Taj Mahal...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked him for five-thousand dollars to feed a buncha motherless babies and you know what he gave me? (taking out the check, wadding it up) Hundred and fifty bucks. That's it. Handed it to me like it was gold bouillon! Sonuvabitch spent more than that on salsa for his party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam coming into the house, enraged, followed by Lynn. his gun cabinet, grabs a hidden key, unlocks it...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had it with these people and all their bullshit about wantin to help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he starts pulling out weapons... shotguns and assault stuffing them into an oversize gun bag...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam Childers... 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn reaching for him and he grabs her wrist... tightly.. at her with dark eyes. A flash of the "old" Sam Childers he says...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay outta my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for the first time in years this woman is scared. He her wrist and continues to fill the bag -- and we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming out followed by the Shop Owner...  SHOP OWNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm sorry, twenty-five hundred is the best I can do for them gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE to see Lynn's car parked at the curb, Sam pointin  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw in the car for five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shop Owner considering, as we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windy, pissing rain. And we see Sam walking up this rural hands in his pockets, head down... the only human for mil trudging through this shitstorm completely alone.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam with a group of men working in the swelter laying brick... adding another room to the children's dor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and he squints into the distance, sees a cloud of dus horizon, cars coming closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven or eight heavily armed vehicles coming through the 20 or 30 SPLA soldiers guarding a black SUBURBAN in the m this motorcade. Nineteen waving his hand, yelling as the  NINETEEN (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Garang! -- It's Garang! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palpable excitement ripples through the compound... Sam's grabbing their weapons and forming a ragged line near the as it stops... 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the back door to the Suburban opens and a black man, shirtsleeves and slacks, steps out. The same man we saw g fiery speech on the little outdoor TV in Nimule earlier - GARANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns to Deng --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this guy?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our leader.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Garang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng nods as we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Garang walking through the middle of camp, traile squad of SPLA bodyguards and camp children...  GARANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They call you Preacher. Is this what I should call you?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is fine.  GARANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear what you have done for the SPLA and I am grateful.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can thank God for his blessins.  GARANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we can. How many children do you look after, Sam?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple hundred with us here. Feed another thousand a day from nearby villages. Anyone who shows up hungry gets a meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they continue through the camp. A few of the children to Garang, touching the cuff of his shirt, then sprinting  GARANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you are doing is noble, but too dangerous. I must advise you to stop risking your life in our struggle. 76  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until someone starts fightin for these children, I'm the one that's gonna do it.  GARANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are stubborn, aren't you?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a mule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garang smiling, an instant affinity for this man.  GARANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I come from very different worlds, but we are not so dissimilar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another child runs up to Garang, touching him, and th away giggling...  GARANG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I founded the SPLA in order to fight for the future of Sudan because nobody else would. We fight for freedom from the government in Khartoum, for the right to vote, and for the right to worship any god one may choose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More children running up... Garang touching their heads..  GARANG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But most important to me is our struggle for the children. Their laughter has been lost to this country for far too long. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are Peace Talks scheduled for the end of August in Naivashu. I'd like you to come as my guest.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talkin bout peace in a room somewhere is a waste of time. You gotta go out and make it.  GARANG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are correct, but we must fight them at every level. Part of my battle is waged in those rooms. We must talk of peace, but keep our rifles ready for war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turning to him, coming to an understanding here. Real both of them are warriors in the same fight.  GARANG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe together you and I can make Sudan free once again. 77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see they have arrived at the brick chapel in t of the compound. Garang turning to him, eyes suddenly bec dark...  GARANG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a cost for freedom, Sam. A price for the future of these people. Some pay with their lives, others pay in different ways. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My only hope is that your cost is not too great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie tucking Paige into bed, making it up as he goes, c of his depth here but wanting to do it right.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say prayers or somethin?  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already did.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok then, sweet dreams.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't you gonna read me a book?  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, Paige, you know I don't read so good.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's play a game.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinkin of a dog.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind, Donnie.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. 78  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad usually kisses me on the forehead before he leaves. You can do that.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Donnie does just that, bends down and kisses Paige on head...  DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see Lynn in the hallway having just witnessed through the cracked door, keenly feeling Sam absence in t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam, Betty and Rose leading a group of childre hands covering their eyes so they can't see, into a clear one of the dorms.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep em closed! A little bit more!  BETTY (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes closed.  ROSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stern, Arabic) Michael! Cover your eyes! No peeking!  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... keep comin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children inching forward, following his voice, until.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, stop! Open your eyes!  BETTY (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see a hundred little eyes popping open, staring at off screen, confused for a split second at what they're l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE to see a PLAYGROUND: two or three battered swings see-saws, and a jungle gym soldered out of metal pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the kids SPRINTING for it, climbing all over the jung ants... hitting the swing-sets... and then we hear it... we realize we haven't heard in this place before... the s laughter... children losing themselves in play. Innocence back. 79

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see Nineteen, A.J. and two other SPLA soldiers around a BUNNY BOUNCER... staring at it quizzically... ta Arabic, trying to decide what this thing is... and then A bravest, slings his AK onto his back and carefully stradd bouncer... pulling up his long legs and resting his feet pegs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he begins to bob back and forth... holding onto the b with his big hands... the other soldiers starting to laug bobs faster... and then we see A.J's smile... a million w on this guy... the first time he's played like this since boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours later and we see Sam pushing a couple of the smalle on the swingset. Deng approaches...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the child soldiers say there is a bounty on your life. That Kony is offering money for your nose and ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, no reaction, just keeps swinging the children...  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to assign a few more men to you during the day.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't the first old-boy who wanted to see my head hanging on his wall. Keep yer soldiers where they're needed. I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng clearly worried for his friend, but doesn't press th And now Sam notices William off from the group, sitting o ground by himself, not playing.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said anything yet?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we know is that his family was killed and that he and his brother were taken into the LRA.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the brother?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows.  NEW ANGLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam approaching William, kneeling down next to him. 80  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey buddy, you don't wanna play with the other kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William, no response.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know sometimes it helps to tell somebody what you got locked up inside, know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William, no reaction whatsoever. Something dawning on Sam moment...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what I'm sayin, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William just stares back at him and Sam realizes he doesn English. And they both just sit here for a moment, silent at the children playing on the playground. And then Sam, need to unburden himself, begins to talk...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I done a lotta things I ain't proud of. Hurt a lotta people. Truth is, helpin you kids is about the only good thing I ever done in this life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William watching him quietly.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm scared. Scared one day I'll close my eyes to all this and make it somebody else's problem. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like everybody else in this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he stops and it's silent between them again. William sitting there quietly. And Sam looks up to the sky... fee life washing over him... his burden... this fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam behind the wheel, driving alone the edge of a dry rav is in the passenger seat and we see Nineteen, Marco and A into the back.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see nuthin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng checking a handheld GPS unit --  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looking out the window, sees movement at the bottom o ravine.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and we see what he sees -- CHILDREN hiding behind a b  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see the SUV picking it's way down the rocky slope. the dry riverbed below and moving closer to the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and the terrain becomes inaccessible and the SUV stop to go any further. Sam and the others getting out of the we see two children hiding behind a bush 50 yards away. S WHISTLING to the kids, but they draw back. Too scared to  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng, tell camp we're comin back with two. A.J., Nineteen -- go get them kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.J. and Nineteen move off as Sam pops the rear hatch on pulls out a MEDICAL BAG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.J. and Nineteen moving over rocks toward the children, to them in Arabic -- "Come out, we won't hurt you." -- bu don't move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and finally they reach the kids and we see it's two b years old), kneeling in the dirt, terrified...

dialogues.speaker: A.J.
dialogues.text: (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, reaches for one of the boys -- and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A BULLET hits A.J. in the neck, killing him instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteen dives behind a boulder for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Deng, and Marco scramble behind the SUV. A moment be hear Nineteen YELLING offscreen. 82  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he sayin?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.J. is dead.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to stay where he is. Don't move.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling to Nineteen, Arabic) Don't move!  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him if he saw the shooter.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling to Nineteen, Arabic) Did you see him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteen responds.  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did not see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNIPER POV -- and we see A.J.'s lifeless body lying by th children... and the SUV... and then part of Sam's head pe behind the truck --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looking through binocs as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A SHOT RINGS OUT! -- hitting the windshield right next head, and he drops behind the truck.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got `em?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He's on the ridge... just below that outcropping.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you reach the Browning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng opening the rear door and reaching inside the truck. out a long barrel HUNTING RIFLE as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet hitting the SUV, narrowly missing Deng. He sli HUNTING RIFLE to Sam. 83  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need you boys to cover me on three, alright? Put everything you got into that rock up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNIPER POV -- locked on the SUV when suddenly -- Deng and pivot around the truck and start firing -- bullets poppin around and the sniper drops for cover as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sam SPRINTS over the rocks and dives into a shallow di sight. Deng and Marco stop firing and drop back behind th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNIPER POV -- slowly pops up from behind the rocks after shooting stops. And we realize he didn't see Sam change p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rolling onto his stomach and slowly sliding the barre rifle between two rocks... then seeing a sliver of the SN on the ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNIPER POV -- still locked on the SUV, waiting for a clea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam putting a bead on the Sniper, but at this range the s going to take instinct. Sam turns his head away from the exhales -- controls his breathing -- as we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNIPER POV -- trained on the SUV... and then we see a FLA right side of the screen... and a delayed POP!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killed instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng looking through binocs at the ridge --  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out to Sam) I think you got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Deng, and Marco moving toward the children, weapons scanning the area in all directions. Deng is the first on the boys who are huddled on the ground, shaking from fear  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is ok. You can get up now. 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the boys don't move... and Deng reaches down, pulls t their feet and we see that their ankles are chained to a has been buried in the ground.  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam joins Deng, sees the chains.  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LRA wanted us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam realizing that these children were used as bait -- fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at the top of the ravine now and we see Sam and the moving toward the location of the SNIPER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and Sam is the first to reach the body... laying on t face down... a pool of blood soaking the dirt underneath. rolls the body onto it's back and we see it's just a kid than 15 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late at night and we see Sam on his cot, sitting her dark. And we hear the sound of his satellite phone vibrat table next to him. He picks it up, sees DONNIE'S name on screen...  SAM (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Donnie on a couch by himself in this shitty li  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONVERSATION
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody ok?  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, everybody's just fine. I was just callin to say `hey' is all.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're the girls? 85  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're good. Paige cooked us all dinner the other night. Chocolate-chip pancakes.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By herself, huh?  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. I helped her with the stove is all. She did everything else. Pretty good too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see Donnie's DOPE WORKS sitting on the table i him. He's using again.  DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it goin over there?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin fine.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, maybe I'll come with you one of these trips. I'd like to get outta here for a spell. See what it's like.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's silent between them... both of these men lost in worries for a moment... and then...  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask you a question?  SAM'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  DONNIE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think God will forgive us for the things we've done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're watching Sam, this question hitting him like a train. Unable to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hit by a crush of people, a thousand black faces mo us and all the noise and confusion of this busy border to find Sam, Deng, and Nineteen here loading supplies into t the SUV.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: They talk about you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turning to find Agnete, the aid worker, approaching h 86  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the camps. The children. They say there is a white preacher who hunts the LRA. This place does not need more killing, Mr. Childers.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tryin to help these people. Same as you.  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War upon war does not fix what is broken here. The history of this country is filled with righteous killers. That is how it always begins, with men thinking they are killing for the right reasons.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a 200 kids who are gonna sleep safe tonight and wake up tomorrow mornin to a bowl of hot food. Right or not, that's all the reason I need.  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about the rumors I have heard about you supplying weapons to the SPLA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turning to her, face-to-face, starting to get pissed.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fight the evil in this place your way, I'll fight it mine.  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not delude yourself, Mr. Childers. You're a mercenary, not a humanitarian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, finished with this conversation, slams the lift-gate the truck and starts to climb in...  AGNETE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say you are doing good. That you have special powers. That you are protected by angels and cannot be killed by bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looking at her and there's a warning in what she says about violence corrupting men... consuming them...  AGNETE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said the same thing about Kony in the beginning. 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sitting outside his tukul alone, tearing open an airm and pulling out another VIDEOCASSETTE, slides it into his videocamera, hits play --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SMALL SCREEN we see a school production... childre in costumes shuffling across the stage... lines being spo rote...and then the awkward entrance of Paige speaking he but instead of finding joy in this sweet moment he finds heartache... the distance from his family... from their i simply too great to bear in this moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then he hears giggling... and he realizes two you BOYS have snuck up behind him and are looking at the scre shoulder... and Sam holds it up so they can see better an children gather around -- maybe 10 or 15 kids -- pointing small screen... giggling and chatting in Arabic...  ORPHAN #1 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at their shoes...  ORPHAN #2 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look silly...  ORPHAN #1 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how Americans dance?  ORPHAN #2 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their dancing is terrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children laughing hysterically... and for an instant swept out of his melancholy by their sweet enjoyment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then Sam sees Deng and Nineteen approaching quick  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin on?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An LRA convoy has moved north over the border. They're heading for Ed Duim.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where they sell em on the black market, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moonless night... and we see headlights piercing this b bouncing down a singletrack road... we are... 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng behind the wheel driving -- Sam in the passenger sea Nineteen, and a third SPLA SOLDIER jammed in the back --  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far ahead we see three sets of HEADLIGHTS coming towards road -- just bouncing white dots on the horizon -- and si they begin to check their mags and weapons -- preparing f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and the headlights get closer -- Deng not slowing down realize we are on a collision course with this convoy -- we see MUZZLE FLASHES in the distance -- and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine gun strafe hitting the front and side of the truc  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Nineteen leaning through the open windows as Deng leveling their AK's and firing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now the approaching convoy LIGHTS UP with RETURN FIRE and Nineteen hanging out the windows blasting back -- Den on the gas, accelerating toward the convoy like some hell "chicken"(reminiscent of Sam and Donnie's wild ride with in scene #29) --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and we watch as the headlights barrel towards us at fu BULLETS POPPING across the windshield of the truck -- SAM

dialogues.speaker: NINETEEN IN CONSTANT FIRE MODE
dialogues.text: blown out on both trucks and now we're plunged into total - only the wild-strobe of machine gun fire lighting up th these trucks slam towards each other -- and finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng skidding to a stop as Sam, Nineteen, and the third S pile out of the truck -- firing and advancing on the cara foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebels jumping out of their disabled trucks -- Sam and hi flanking them -- blasting one of the trucks until the eng into flames -- cutting down the rebels before they even k hit them. And then there's a great stillness. The quiet o 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sam coming out of the blackness with his AK leveled.. toward the flaming wreckage of the caravan... Deng, Ninet Marco moving to each rebel body... making sure they're de  NINETEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Deng moving to the back of the Transport Truck...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco hustling up with a spotlight -- Sam switching it on rips the canvas back and we see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys and girls... none of them older than twelve... tied with rope... emaciated... terrified... in very bad shape.  MARCO (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front axle is broken... this truck won't drive.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck is too damaged to move. (meaning the children) We don't have room for them all, Preacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The implication of this hitting Sam, his mind reeling, tu Nineteen...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring our truck up here and shine them lights on us. (TO DENG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull everyone of them kids outta there.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to soldiers, Arabic) Bring the children out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng and Marco helping the children out... one-by-one... them...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put em right here... real easy...  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them together here... gently... 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Nineteen pulls up in the SUV, lighting up the chi  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're takin the ones that ain't gonna make it through the night. Come back for the others later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam moves to the first child in the group -- a little reaching out to her but she pulls back.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I'm not gonna hurt her.  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok... he will not hurt you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And slowly the little girl steps forward... and Sam gentl her shirt and begins to examine her little body... turnin around in the harsh light of the SUV's headlamps... and h five infected gashes on her back... whip wounds... alread gangrene... and he gently pushes her toward Deng...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put her in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam continues with the group... assessing each child' tenderly running his hands over their broken, starved bod somehow calculating which ones are worse off and pulling line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and he reaches the last child and we see that the SUV PACKED with children... huddled into every available corn children in total. There's no more room.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell em we're comin back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng hesitating, knows the reaction he's going to get...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell em!  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will be back for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children become hysterical, crying, running at Sam an for him, begging to be taken. 91  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! (to the children, holding up TWO FINGERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hours... I'll be back in two hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Deng, and the others loading into the SUV... some of climbing onto the roof... the only available space... the children clamoring around the truck as it begins to pull  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell em to hide. Don't come out til they see my face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng yelling this to the children as they drive off...  DENG (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide until we return!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the faint cries of the children slowly fading as they the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red sun breaking the horizon. It's ONE HOUR LATER and w SUV blasting through the front gate of the compound and s a stop -- DOORS POPPING OPEN -- SOLDIERS JUMPING OFF THE Betty and the other camp women already pulling the childr the truck... ushering them into the infirmary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam yelling at another soldier as he walks across the cou  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas it up! We're leavin here in five!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hours into this return trip and it's silent in this c checking a handheld GPS, clocking their position, and the it -- through the windshield -- in the distance --  SMOKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rising in a thin column a half-mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene of the ambush the night before. Burned out pick and dead LRA rebels strewn in the dirt. Sam's SUV arrivin the first one out... whistling for the children but they' to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we realize that the column of smoke isn't coming bombed-out LRA trucks -- it's coming from behind them. Sa around the back of the TRANSPORT TRUCK to see -- 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children Sam left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burned alive by the LRA an hour earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam just standing here, staring at this smoldering pile o Starting to go someplace very dark. And as he puts it, mo died in the bush this morning too.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see a line of American TRAVELERS waiting to be che through customs... BUSINESS MEN in their rumpled suits ca briefcases, PARENTS with their tired children returning f vacation... and Sam standing in this line with his duffel somehow cut-off from the life all around him. And the CUS OFFICER waves him forward... Sam handing him his passport  CUSTOMS OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he looks up, studies Sam --

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMS OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam has no answer for him. This question begin plague him like a festering sore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining and we see Sam sitting on a bench waiting, s at a SKYCAB TROLLEY. Two men working through a pile of BL BAGS, heaped on top of each other like bodies, tossing th one into the back of the trolley...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looking up as Donnie gets out of his car, smiling.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. Sixteen was all jammed up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie is strung out, but Sam is too deep in his own shit  DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BANK MANAGER at a desk, in a gray suit, shaking his hea 93  BANK MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand what you're saying, but there's just not a lot we can do, until we pay down some of what you owe my hands are tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE to see Sam sitting in a chair across from him, a folder filled with his business papers sitting on his lap  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just an application for a short term loan.  BANK MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, we already took out a second on your home.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only 90 days.  BANK MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're completely leveraged.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only got one truck over there, John. I need the money to buy a second vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opens a manilla folder and pulls out a photo of a tru sale.    SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important. Now, there's one in Kampala I can probably get for twenty- one...  BANK MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Sam, we know what you're doing over there in Africa and we support it but ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leans over the desk and sets another photograph down him -- and we see it's a gruesome photograph of a mutilat  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to look at this. See that? Twelve year old boy had both his arms cut off by LRA...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An employee approaches the bank manager with something to looks down at the photos. The Bank Manager becoming uncom  BANK MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam... It's not necessary. 94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pulls out another photograph and sets it in front of Manager -- this one even more gruesome...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this John, when we found this little girl her breasts had been hacked off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank Manager not looking at the photograph...  BANK MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, this isn't necessary...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her. Look at this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank Manager glancing at the photograph then looking away  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I ain't in here askin fer money fer a hot tub or vacation or somethin like that. I'm askin for an extra vehicle so I can save some children. You understand that?  BANK MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, but...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nuthin. I need you to open yer little book there and do whatever you need to do to get me that loan...  BANK MANAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, You need to calm down...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me to calm down! Look at those pictures! -- Look at em, John --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he slams the desk with his open hand, taking us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A/C on the fritz and it's blistering hot in here. 150 par in pews waving themselves with hand fans trying to stay c see Sam at the pulpit in mid-sermon, shirt pitted and rol his elbows. The rage in this man is palpable.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Open yer eyes!... Wake up!... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call yerselves children of God, but you ain't. Ya'll just sheep followin him deaf, dumb, and blind... (AMPED-UP) (MORE) 95 SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But God don't want sheep. He wants wolves to fight his fight. Men and women with teeth to tear at the evil that's out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The congregation whipped into a frenzy. A few of them jum their feet, shouting praise...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see John Garang in the back of this car as it driv downtown Kampala.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam becoming more possessed...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The congregation responding, "Amen!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcade pulling to a stop. Garang and other GOVERNM OFFICIALS getting out and making their way to a waiting H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, a building fury...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garang and the others loading into the helicopter, lockin Propellers starting to rotate. 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter lifting off the ground, ascending into the sky until it's just a speck in the limitless blue...

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And only then will their hearts beat no more... and they will be turned to dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige and her girlfriend from her 7th grade class sit on landing. Donnie flips through a magazine, Lynn puts away Chatter here about an upcoming formal...  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Strauss and them is havin dinner at The Chimney.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's her date?  PAIGE'S FRIEND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Wilks.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Tony Wilkes was goin with Patty Hobbes' daughter.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They broke up last month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see Sam off from the group, absently watching an adjoining room... and a NEWS REPORT begins... a PICTUR GARANG flashing on the screen... Sam moving closer to the can hear --  TV NEWSCASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sudanese opposition leader John Garang has been killed in a helicopter crash according to a statement released by the Sudanese Government in Khartoum today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam going completely still... 97

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSCASTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Garang was hailed as a peacemaker in Sudan and was instrumental in ending the 21-year civil war that has ravaged that country.

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSCASTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Six of Garang's associates and seven others also died in the crash which is being blamed on bad weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam frozen, shocked... just staring at the TV as the news switches to another story...

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad? -- Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looking up to find everybody staring at him.  PAIGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about us gettin a limo for next weekend? Wouldn't be too expensive since there'd be six of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam lost here for a moment...  PAIGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hel-lo? Earth to Dad? What do you think?  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you ok?  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heck, why don't I just drive ya'll?  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't crammin in the back of your Caprice.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll could fit in there easy.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got dresses, Donnie! We'll get all wrinkled! Plus it smells in there.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get some freshener, Paige, that ain't no problem.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, what you think? Can we get a limo? 98  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. Please. Patty and them is gettin one.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't rentin no limo to Pittsburgh.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could probably get us a deal through one of Tom Hickey's boys. Between the six of them it wouldn't cost too much.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's spendin money on no friggin limousine.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam snapping, FLASHING WITH RAGE --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. Nobody moving. Completely still. And then...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just talkin bout it, honey...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much talk in this house. I got mouths to feed and you're talkin bout pissing money away on a limo.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my formal, dad.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit what it is! You ain't gettin no limo, end of story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears welling up in Paige's eyes, anger, hurt, wanting to at him somehow. And what she says next she's felt her who  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love them black babies more than you love me.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: SLAP IT
dialogues.text: 99  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie instinctively grabbing his arm, protective...  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam spins -- gets in his face -- eyes dark and threat  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you think you're doin, boy?  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: SHUT THE FUCK UP
dialogues.text: DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, buddy.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me to take it easy in my own fuckin house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Donnie toe-to-toe and the threat of serious viole Tension like a hair trigger.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't your wife and this ain't your family. You nuthin but a stray fuckin dog round here, boy.  DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mean that...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell I don't. Now you get the fuck outta here fore I put yer head through that wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie standing here, hurt... looking to Lynn to make sur alright and she nods for him to go... and he turns and wa Paige bursting into tears and running out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded, noisy outlaw bar in Johnstown. We see Sam sitt bar all alone, a shot of whisky and a bottle of beer in f him. Staring into a void.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You that Preacher, ain't ya? 100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns to find a burly looking BIKER standing next to smiling.  BIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, you him. I seen your face in the papers few years ago. Call you the Machinegun Preacher, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods.  BIKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his buddies) Told you this is the guy. (TO SAM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot damn, I knew it! Papers was talkin bout how you was like some kinda African Rambo or somethin, right?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind, I'd like to just sit here right now.  BIKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still helpin them niggers over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam bristling...  BIKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I figure it, the reason you so interested in helpin them porch monkeys is cause you probably throwin it in them nigger bitches, ain't ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Biker smiles a nasty, malicious smile. His buddies mo to him now... and we see a quiet storm brewing in Sam...  BIKER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I right? You a nigger fucker, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam staring at the Biker with a look we've come to know -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACKKKK! -- Sam HEAD-BUTTS the Biker's face and a sudden brawl breaks out -- Bikers swinging cue sticks -- Sam wad the crew -- swinging wild -- taking the Biker down and st his face -- bloody -- murderous -- and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam released, coming out a door and we see Lynn's car par parking lot, engine idling. 101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn behind the wheel as Sam comes around the passenger d gets in. And the two of them just sit here for a long bea  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna sit there and you're gonna lemme talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEAT. Sam says nothing.  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always believed in you. I trusted you, trusted the Lord, and did what I could so you could follow your dream. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I ain't willin to lose you to what you're doin over there. Ain't gonna just stand by and watch you get swallowed up by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks to him and we see she has tears in her eyes...  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're all them kids got, but you're all we got too. Paige needs her father. I need my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sitting in a chair in the dark. And we hear his cell on the desk. He picks it up and sees DONNIE'S name on the a moment here and then he sets the phone back down... doe it... as we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie on a couch and he looks like hell... pale, gaunt f phone at his ear listening to RINGING and RINGING... and sound of Sam's voice...  RECORDED MESSAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here's Sam. You know what to do. (BEEEEP)  DONNIE (QUIETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey buddy, it's Donnie. Shoot, I was hopin' you was there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie hesitating... doesn't hang-up... and we can feel h needs to talk to somebody...  DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other day I was thinkin bout when you and me was kids. (MORE) 102 DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That summer we'd go down to the quarry over in Montrose, remember that? We hooked up them ropes and spent all day swimmin and jumpin off them walls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie smiling to himself, a fleeting memory, and then so dark coming over him. And now we see another man here in dope house, cooking up a spoon of black tar, juicing a ne Donnie watching him like a hawk...  DONNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you was there to pray with me, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eastern White Pine wrapped in early morning fog. Hazy. Fl a dream. And then the sound of WOOD SPLINTERING... and we alone in this vapor cutting logs with an axe. Sweating de chill in the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then a voice from somewhere far off. Sam stopping into the haze as a figure materializes... coming toward h his name... at first it looks like Donnie... but then we Lynn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when she reaches him her look tells us something terr happened.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONNIE'S CORPSE lying in a casket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with mourners. And we hear a CHILDREN'S CHOIR sing plaintive hymnal... "My Jesus, I love thee"... and Donnie in the first pew, dressed in black, surrounded by a few o offering her comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see Sam moving up the steps to the platform... choir softly finishes... and he looks out over the congre not saying a word for a long beat... and then...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of you want me to stand up here and make some sense outta this. That's why you come here today. You want me to tell you that God has his plan for all of us, and when he wants to call us back home he's gonna do it. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you wanna hear... (QUIETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you wanna hear... 103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam stops, unable to continue... just stares out at t congregation... at the expectant faces looking back at hi waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but he steps away from the lectern, down the steps, a the aisle toward the exit... the congregation staring at passes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours later. Lynn and Paige still dressed from the funera up the driveway to their house.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, who are those men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD we see a FLATBED TRUCK parked next house and 7 or 8 MOVERS pulling heavy machinery out of th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn getting out of the car, approaching some of the men.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'cuse me, what are you doing?  MOVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loadin up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she makes her way into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with movers busily hauling equipment out of the ga coming in, confused...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, s'cuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now she sees Sam going through a cabinet in the back.  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, what's goin on? What are these men doin here?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam slamming the cabinet closed, moving past her without word. Lynn grabbing his arm, stopping him.  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they taking our stuff?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't ours no more. Best go through and make sure they ain't takin nuthin that belongs in the house. 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she sees two men start to dismantle the "Childers Con Company" sign that she painted herself years ago --  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! -- Don't touch that! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam moving toward the house. Lynn comes out of the barn a  LYNN (CALLING AFTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's not stopping. He reaches the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sam coming inside, moving to the kitchen... Lynn foll  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I know you're hurtin. I know you're angry, but we need to talk about this...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all done, so save yer breath... where's the keys to the safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
