dialogues.text: Sam grabs papers from the counter and hands them to Lynn. quickly pages through them, can't believe what she's read  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sold the business for $27,000?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a new truck for the orphanage.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new truck? You sold our business for a new truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam finds the Keys.  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was our future, Sam. Paige's future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn follows Sam into the office. 105  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything we have has gone to those children, Sam. There's a point when there ain't no more to give.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the combination? What's the fucking combination.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paige's birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam starts to spin the combination but hesitates...  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know it, do you? You don't even remember your own daughter's birthday.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the numbers?  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fight for everyone but us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves past him, spinning the combination and cranking vault. Sam grabbing a couple stacks of cash.  LYNN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take that and we lose the house. The church. All of it.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can make it up with the ministry.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ministry?! They see what you've become, Sam. They see how far gone you are. You need to get quiet with The Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he looks to her...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the Lord.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. Don't turn yer back on him.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He turned his back on me! -- on Donnie! -- on every one of them kids over there.  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good you're doin is destroyin this family. 106  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good have I ever done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam standing here, weighing something in his mind. A choi make here... and finally he moves past her...  LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's gone.  CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam moving across this crowded tarmac. Disconn bit frightening. And he's greeted by Deng.  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sam says nothing, and Deng sees that his eyes are des Inevitable. And Sam moves past him without saying a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 or 40 adults and children here eating the last meal of And we see Sam in a corner, off from the rest of the grou maybe it's just the lighting in here, but there's a darkn him -- literally as if the space surrounding this man is light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see William working his way through the room... re cups with hot tea... his particular job here... and he co Sam and accidently sloshes some of the tea onto Sam's arm flinches! -- burned -- "Damn it!" -- shoots his arm out a accidentally hits William in the chest -- knocking him ba the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire room falls silent. Nobody moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam gets up and walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A convoy of 2 OR 3 AID RELIEF TRUCKS coming down this dir we see Agnete here with a DRIVER in the first truck as th onto a NARROW BRIDGE -- and just before they reach the ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PICKUP TRUCK filled with heavily armed LRA REBELS pulls of them, cutting them off.  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck grinding to a halt. The driver becoming terrifi to jam the truck into reverse --  AGNETE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no! -- don't go back --  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: US
dialogues.text: AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You move and they'll shoot! -- calm down! -- I will talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnete climbing out of the truck as we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebels jumping out of the pickup truck and moving up the Agnete approaches -- holding up her hands --  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ok -- we are a relief convoy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnete and the LRA LEADER meet in the middle of the bridg  AGNETE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have only medical supplies -- non- MILITARY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly the LRA LEADER slams her in the gut with the his rifle and she collapses. The other Rebels swarm all o convoy, pulling out AID WORKERS and DRIVERS, forcing them knees in a group.  ADULT REBEL #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on your knees!... Get down!...  DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE DON'T KILL US
dialogues.text: ADULT REBEL #4 (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your knees or we will take your legs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone terrified -- some of them sobbing -- Agnete look trying to talk to the LRA LEADER--  AGNETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are only a relief convoy --  LRA LEADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth! 108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and he SLAMS her in the face with the butt of his rifl goes down hard... and he rests the barrel of his rifle on of her head... he's going to shoot her -- and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His chest EXPLODES! -- three bursts from behind -- the ot spinning toward the gunshots as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A firestorm of lead -- Sam, Deng, and the rest of his tea onto the bridge shooting -- rebels scrambling for cover b late -- dropping as they try and sprint away -- and in an it's all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agnete sees Sam, rushes toward him, but when he looks at freezes. He is completely unrecognizable to her in this m killer's thousand-yard stare -- barely human -- more like than a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he moves past her down the bridge, to the LRA LEADER ground who is still alive. And he puts the barrel of his against the rebel's head and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. Just like that. And he continues walking up th And we see Agnete, Deng and the other soldiers having jus this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William coming in quietly, moving next to one of the capt from the previous scene who is shackled to a bed, injured soldiers here standing guard.  WILLIAM (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to ask you something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William pulls out the photograph of his brother, holds it  WILLIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my brother. His name is Christopher. He was stolen by the rebels. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know if he is alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rebel looks at the photograph but says nothing, just head... and he looks off, his thousand yard stare inscrut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And William simply folds the photograph back up and slips his pocket... but he doesn't leave... he sits here a mome longer... quietly... thinking... and then... 109  WILLIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you taken when you were young like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rebel hears this and turns to him... and nods his hea  WILLIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember your parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see something happening in this hardened rebel... filling with a distant memory... a sadness... and slowly head again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we stay here with these two lost souls sitting next t other... silent... connected by a shared history and angu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sitting alone, lost to the world around him. Deng app Neither one acknowledging the other for a long beat until  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear that, Preacher?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no more laughter. The children do not play here anymore. They are scared once again. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now they are scared of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, no response.  DENG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men do not trust you any longer to lead them into battle. They say you have a wish to die. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am worried about my friend. I want to help him.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam turns away. After a beat Deng walks off, leaving once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam here in the dark... moonlight filtering in the thatched roof... like shards of glass cutting through blackness... and he doesn't look right here... soul worn eyes hollow... starting to go someplace very bad... 110

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... IMAGES FLASHING IN HIS HEAD... babies burned and scre Donnie in his coffin... and we realize we're watching som here... his world starting to cave in on him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and he drops against his cot... distraught... tears i and this man is breaking... and suddenly we see a gun in finger curling around the trigger as he puts it to his he closing against the world... and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam frozen... still holding the gun... and slowly the doo open and we hear soft footsteps shuffling into this dark

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and William steps into the light, sees Sam here on th with the gun in his hand... and slowly he moves next to h on the cot without saying a word... just the two of them moment... and then slowly he begins in perfect English...  WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember my parents when I sleep. I see them in my dreams sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looking to William... this small boy sitting above hi telling his story...  WILLIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father was big like you. They shot him. We were so scared. Then the rebels gave me a club and told me if I didn't kill my mother they would shoot my brother and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And William pauses in his story... lost in this memory... becoming a mask of pain... but no tears... there are no m in this young man left to be shed... and so he continues.  WILLIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I refused, but my mother told me to swing hard... that I must make her proud... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so I did. I made her proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now William looks down at Sam... staring at this man ground... and he reaches out and gently touches Sam's hea moment of tenderness for both of them... an act of love.. two broken souls finding each another here... and William  WILLIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we allow ourselves to become full of hate then they've won. We must not let them take our hearts. This is the most important thing. 111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam sets the gun down and reaches out to William, pul an embrace... holding him close... and we know that witho this boy has saved this man's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft Christian music is playing on the radio. Lynn foldin in the laundry room when the phone rings. Paige comes int upstairs hallway and answers it.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, into phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam on his sat phone --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bug? You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's me.  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ok?  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ok, Bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's a long pause... so much to say but no words t each of them holding their phones to their ears and just listening... and finally Sam says...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinkin of a tree...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see tears well up in Paige's eyes when she hears t now we see Lynn coming around the corner, overhearing the begin their little game one more time...  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said tree... I'm thinkin of a knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam smiling to himself... and we realize this man is comi life when he says...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said knee, I'm thinkin of bee... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Bug. 112  PAIGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn hearing this and tears roll down her cheeks as we go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see the soldiers at their posts... Betty and the o Women cleaning clothes and preparing food... and we see m children loitering around a tree in the shade, sullen, no on the playground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we see Sam coming into the courtyard kicking a s ball... some of the children see him and point... and slo entire camp begins to notice Sam kicking the soccer ball by himself out in the open... Betty and the other women s their chores and watching him, speaking to one another in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng and the other soldiers staring as Sam pops the ball air and bounces it off his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now a couple of the smaller kids sprint for him a them the ball... and slowly the rest of the children join fun... kicking the ball back and forth... an impromptu so game... and then we hear LAUGHTER again... joy flooding b this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng watching with a big smile as this white man dances a little children... a Pied Piper of joy... playing in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see William approach a knot of soldiers standing b gate smoking cigarettes...  WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...  SPLA SOLDIER #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true an LRA commander was captured last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers nodding their heads "yes."  WILLIAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he being held?  SPLA SOLDIER #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the army base in Kisoro.  WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going there? 113  SPLA SOLDIER #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ride with you?  SPLA SOLDIER #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want to go to Kisoro?  WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to ask the commander something.  SPLA SOLDIER #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you cannot ride with us. Wait till tomorrow and go with the women on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the soldiers turn their backs on William and he slink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a line of women along the riverbank in their color dresses... scrubbing pans and washing clothes... singing African spiritual as they work... the sun dropping pale r horizon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Sam here too... alone with himself... sitting river's edge, watching the water rolling gently past... l the soft serenade of the women... the beauty of it all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then he gets up and walks into the river... and h down so that water reaches his waist (reminiscent of his baptism in scene #35)... and now the women on the riverba their work, watching him as he closes his eyes and gently back... submitting to the water... and when he comes up a in his eyes that his soul has been saved in this simple a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the women begin to shout their praise from the riverb go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see William here alone, pulling out a small satche filling it with a bottle of water and a blanket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William at the edge of the compound... looking over his s make sure nobody is watching him... and then quickly slip the fence and he's gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William walking through the dry scrub alone... already a miles deep in the bush... the sun starting to set... ligh William starting to get nervous, picking up his pace... 114

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squad of LRA rebels coming through the scrub... William under a bush, terrified... the men coming closer... no id saw him or not... his mind racing... voices getting loude starting to hyper-ventilate from the fear -- and --  WILLIAM BOLTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprinting through the bush -- running for his life -- reb -- yelling for him to stop -- chasing him down -- shootin rifles into the air and he hits the ground in the fetal p too terrified to continue -- eyes clamped shut as 4 or 5 surround him -- guns pointed at his head -- caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam coming into the building, finding Betty tending to a  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen William?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty shaking her head "no", and we see the worry on Sam' intuitively knows something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William bound and gagged being dragged through the bush b rebels... and one of the rebels sees him staring at them brings the butt of his Kalishnikov down hard -- striking the head as we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng coming up to Sam...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the soldiers said he was asking about the commander that is being held at Kismoro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam closing his eyes, knows instantly what William has do  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get em on the phone, see if he's shown up at the base yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William shoved through the bush... moving deeper into thi encampment... dark and otherworldly... figures moving aro fires... laughing... men with little girls... their child with pregnant bellies... and incongruously the sound of A music coming from a jambox somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The overriding sense we get from this place is one of `in 115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And William is dragged to a clearing next to a grouping o he's kicked to the dirt... two other soldiers pinning him ground as a third grabs his feet and pulls off his shoes. YELLING and now a handful of other LRA soldiers start to around... most of them only a few years older than him... as his ankles are bound together and placed on a wooden b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now another soldier steps forward with an AXE... crowd whips into bloodlust... shouting... cheering...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier freezes -- everyone turning as an LRA COMMAND through the crowd -- takes the axe from the soldier --  SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ran from us.  COMMANDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is worth nothing with no feet. Put him with the others until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng hustling up to Sam... shaking his head...  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have not see the boy.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok. Get Nineteen and Marco -- we're gonna go look for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see William in a bamboo cell in the center of camp see other children here... in various stages of fear and suffering... some of them completely naked... shivering i air... others catatonic, probably doped up or too battere

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Deng, Nineteen and Marco in this lead truck... been for hours... behind them we see the second camp truck fol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they come to a fork in the road, pulling to a stop. 116  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be light soon. What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looking at a topo map on his lap...  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go through Maridi, see if they've seen anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pale yellow sun breaking and we see William and a line of other children -- shackled in iron -- being loaded into t a TRANSPORT TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both SUV's parked off the side of the road now. Sam and D looking at maps and the GPS tracker. And we hear Deng's r squawk. He digs it out, responds in Arabic, then turns to  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The village outside of Akot says an LRA caravan came through there an hour ago. They were headed for Ed Duim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A convoy of 4 or 5 LRA trucks barreling down this dirt tr see lots of rebels standing up in the back of these truck heavy weapons, alert -- and suddenly we see in the distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From different angles -- converging on the LRA convoy -- see them and point -- they know what's coming and they be prepare for war --  THE ROOSTER-TAILS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting closer -- and then we see them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bouncing over the terrain towards us -- coming fast -- an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An RPG streaks toward the lead LRA truck and -- KABOOOM! truck is blown off it's axles -- the other LRA trucks pul the road -- and suddenly we're in a withering firefight - of heavy weapons at full-tilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumping out of their trucks and flanking the LRA convoy - triangulating fire -- shredding the rebels -- blowing the their feet.  NINETEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprinting through the bush -- edging around the LRA truck finding a position on their weak side and locking an RPG launcher -- shouldering it -- aiming -- WOOOOSH! -- the m streaking toward the second LRA jeep and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's blasted into the air -- onto it's side -- rebels scu from the wreckage -- still firing -- an absolute hail of AK's barking in every direction --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the rebels standing up -- firing an RPG -- WOOOOOS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCO crouched behind the new orphanage truck firing -- s white streak coming at him -- dives -- just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM moving closer to the rebels -- shooting -- picking th by one -- gunfire raking over his head -- a dozen muzzle coming from everywhere -- Sam yelling over the thunder --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! -- Go! -- Go! -- Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see Deng coming out of the bush to his right -- an Nineteen to his left -- and they charge on the remaining Sam providing covering fire -- a curtain of lead cutting enemy -- and just like that it's over -- Sam waving behin  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cease fire!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and suddenly there's just a sick silence -- smoke risi shot-to-shit LRA trucks -- bodies strewn in the dirt -- t new orphanage truck bombed out and smoking on it's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sam makes his way to the first TRANSPORT TRUCK -- Den him as he rips the canvas back to see --

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN CRAMMED INTO THE BACK OF THIS TRUCK
dialogues.text: SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull em all out! C'mon, let's go!  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Soldiers, Arabic) Take them out. 118

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers start to unload the children --  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut them loose!  DENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to soldier, Arabic) Cut the ropes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam moves to the second TRANSPORT TRUCK, rips the canvas FIND --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fuck indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been here before... 100 kids and he only has one goo vehicle... and we watch him standing here... staring at t faces looking back at him... a moment... lost in indecisi one of the kids stands up near the back...  IT'S WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sees him and suddenly he knows exactly what he needs  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'MON, LET'S GO!... get em out of there and line em up! -- C'MON! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we've seen this before... Sam going through these chi assessing their health... one by one... separating the wo from the others... forming two group... turning to Deng a and motioning to the smaller group (about 15 children)...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load these here into the truck. Put em three deep if you have to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deng herding the children toward the one good truck...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Marco, Arabic) Come with me --  NEW ANGLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Marco moving from one dead LRA rebel to the other them onto their backs... going through their belts... pul extra ammo clips and grenades...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them AK's too. (ARABIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco swinging four or five machine guns onto his shoulde 119  NEW ANGLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the SUV, now jammed with children. Sam talking to Nine and the others...  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need all you to climb up on that roof and keep yer eyes peeled. That road back might be hot, so be ready.  NINETEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Preacher?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We're staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns to see Deng next to him, holding an AK in his h steely resolve in his eyes. Sam nods, emboldened by his s  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the soldiers) Go on. Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers load onto the SUV and drive off, leaving Sam standing here in the middle of these 85 children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for the war that will surely come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we stay in this truck as it pulls away... driving for time... until Sam, Deng, and the children become only spe horizon... and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To this day, Sam Childers fights for the children of Sud Northern Uganda."    THE END 120  LEGENDS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph Kony and his Lord's Resistance Army continue their terror in Sudan and Northern Uganda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amnesty International estimates that Kony and the LRA are responsible for over 400,000 murders and more than 40,000 abductions. These children are tortured, raped, sold into slavery, and forced to take part in ritualized killing by commanders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Islamic Government of Sudan continues to provide weap safe haven to Kony and the LRA as part of a deal to wage against the predominately Christian South.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without pressure from the United States, this support wil and more innocent children will be slaughtered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know. 121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As of 2011, Sam Childers has rescued over 800 children fr His `Angels of East Africa Orphanage' is home to more tha orphans, and feeds over 1200 meals a day to neighboring v need.
